授業目的: This course is meant to study basics and applications of molecular spectroscopy. Molecular spectroscopy is now widely used as a vital tool in various fields ranging from chemistry to materials science to biomedical science. This course is focused on several spectroscopic techniques including not only conventional techniques but also state-of-the-art techniques such as super-resolution microscopy and laser trapping. A focus is also placed on the applications of those techniques in scientific research.
到達目標: The course goal is to understand the quantum mechanical theory behind molecular spectroscopy and to learn about various molecular spectroscopic techniques and their applications in biomedical and materials sciences.
授業方法:
Lecture, in-class presentation, and discussion
Two lectures on Raman spectroscopy are given by Shigeto and the other 12 lectures by Liu.
【Students who are permitted to take this course online】Online lectures will be given, for details including ZOOM links please check LUNA.

参考書/Reference books1: Physical Chemistry for the Life Sciences (2nd ed.)
参考書/Reference books2: C. R. Cantor, P. R. Simmel
Biophysical Chemistry Part II: Techniques for the Study of Biological Structure and Function (1st ed.)
参考書/Reference books3: D. A. Skoog, F. J. Holler
